passage_text: Answer by Steve Cohen. Confidence votes 3.1K. A hyphen (also known as a dash or minus sign) looks like this: - On most standard QWERTY-style computer keyboards, a hyphen or dash appears above the letter 'P' and to the right of the number zero. It may also appear on the keyboard's number pad as a minus sign.

A single dash used to connect two words to create a compound word. A hyphen is like a dash. It is used when writing numbers (like forty-two) or in words such as mother … -in-law, ex-wife, and president-elect. Often, it is hard to say whether or not a word is hyphenated.

The hyphen (‐) is a punctuation mark used to join words and to separate syllables of a single word. The use of hyphens is called hyphenation. The hyphen should not be confused with dashes (‒ , – , — , ―), which are longer and have different uses, or with the minus sign (−), which is also longer in some contexts.

1 How and When to Hyphenate Words Hyphens are another form of punctuation that is often misused. 2  Not to be confused with a dash, the hyphen key looks like a single short line 3  (-). There are many uses of hyphe…. 4  The Use of the Christian Cross as a Religious Symbol Using symbols is important for many religions.
What does a hyphen look like? – is a punctuation mark used to join words and to separate syllables of a single word.
